comments:
In WTP M4, when I run JBoss 3.2.3 from the server view, I get the following 
error when I try to access the JBoss JMX Console which I use to debug JNDI 
lookup problems.

org.apache.jasper.JasperException: Unable to compile class for JSP

An error occurred at line: -1 in the jsp file: null

Generated servlet error:
    [javac] Compiling 1 source file
    [javac] C:\devl\jboss-3.2.3\server\default\work\MainEngine\localhost\jmx-
console\displayMBeans_jsp.java:98: cannot access javax.management.ObjectName
    [javac] file javax\management\ObjectName.class not found
    [javac]          String name = data[d].getObjectName().toString();
    [javac]                            ^
    [javac] Note: C:\devl\jboss-3.2.3
\server\default\work\MainEngine\localhost\jmx-console\displayMBeans_jsp.java 
uses or overrides a deprecated API.
    [javac] Note: Recompile with -deprecation for details.
    [javac] 1 error

at org.apache.jasper.compiler.DefaultErrorHandler.javacError
(DefaultErrorHandler.java:130)
	at org.apache.jasper.compiler.ErrorDispatcher.javacError
(ErrorDispatcher.java:293)
	at org.apache.jasper.compiler.Compiler.generateClass(Compiler.java:353)
	at org.apache.jasper.compiler.Compiler.compile(Compiler.java:370)
	at org.apache.jasper.JspCompilationContext.compile
(JspCompilationContext.java:473)
	at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServletWrapper.service
(JspServletWrapper.java:190)
	at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServlet.serviceJspFile
(JspServlet.java:295)
	at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServlet.service(JspServlet.java:241)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:853)


When I run JBoss from outside Eclipse/WTP, I don't get this error. I thought it 
might be the picking up a JRE rather than a JDK and it might be having problems 
with compiling JSPs, but verifed it is picking up a 1.4.2 JDK. So, I am 
wondering if a jar was on included in the server configuration files.

This worked fine for me in WTP M3.

The JDK would have been my first guess too, but maybe it's missing the JMX jar
that contains javax.management.ObjectName?

Yes the server definition for JBoss seems to be missing a couple of libraries. I
have added these to the server definition file. The fix is in CVS now. Thank you
for the report.
Changed Version field given new release numbering.
Closing old bugs that haven't had any activity in a couple months. If this problem has not been verified or you still have problems, please open a new bug.

traces.message: Unable to compile class for JSP  An error occurred at line: -1 in the jsp file: null  Generated servlet error:     [javac] Compiling 1 source file     [javac] C:\devl\jboss-3.2.3\server\default\work\MainEngine\localhost\jmx- console\displayMBeans_jsp.java:98: cannot access javax.management.ObjectName     [javac] file javax\management\ObjectName.class not found     [javac]          String name = data[d].getObjectName().toString();     [javac]                            ^     [javac] Note: C:\devl\jboss-3.2.3 \server\default\work\MainEngine\localhost\jmx-console\displayMBeans_jsp.java  uses or overrides a deprecated API.     [javac] Note: Recompile with -deprecation for details.     [javac] 1 error
